posts.name: Shawn
posts.cooked: I connected the Raspberry Pi 3 to the robot’s radio via ethernet cable, with 2 HD cameras connected to the rPi, in addition to a cable running from the rPi to the PDP. I tried connecting to http://roborio-3341-frc.local:5800/ , photonvision.local:5800 , 10.te.am.11:5801 , and 172.22.11.2:5800 when connected to the robot wifi, and I am unable to open up Photonvision. What should I do to be able to access the Photonvision pipeline?

Use an ip scanner app (we use amgry ip scanner) to find the ip of rpi. (You need to be connected to robot wifi while doing this step.) Also use

You need to be able to see photonvision.local in ip scanner, paste that ip to a browser and add at the end :5800, if it doesn’t open check wirings.

posts.name: Shawn
posts.cooked:
Thanks, now I can access photonvision.local:5800, but can only see one camera stream, but I want to see two camera streams side-by-side. How would I go upon doing this? image 1920×972 260 KB

image 1920×972 260 KB

image 1920×972 260 KB

posts.name: neev dadhania
posts.cooked: the photonvision webpage cannot show two cameras (and as far as I know, it cannot do processing on two cameras either), so your best bet to see two streams is by viewing them in driverstation or setting up two CameraServer widgets in shuffleboard

posts.name: Shawn
posts.cooked: Thank you, if I do have the two streams in driverstation or shuffleboard, will I be able to change the pipeline for one camera to detect reflective tape and april tags and another to detect game pieces?
It cannot show the streams of two cameras at once but two cameras can do processing at one time.

posts.name: neev dadhania
posts.cooked: no, any changes to photonvision configuration would have to be made in the photonvision website. viewing the streams in driverstation/shuffleboard is useful for a clean driverstation display

posts.name: Shawn
posts.cooked: So I can change the pipelines for each camera and then I can see both on driverstation or shuffleboard, but there won’t be any outline to indicate what the target is?

posts.name: neev dadhania
posts.cooked:
any outlines/markers placed on the processed video by photonvision is visible on the stream in ds/sb. for example, if you have the 2D apriltags pipeline enabled, the stream in ds/sb will have the red outline surrounding the tag as well as the green ID.

in other words, the stream in ds/sb is the processed stream

posts.name: Shawn
posts.cooked: Great, thank you for the help!
